page.title: 14SCHOOL SWIMMING POOL
page.content: The school is fortunate enough to have its own open air swimming pool measuring 36 feet by 24 feet. It was opened by Mr Jeremy Thorpe who was then M.P. for North Devon. The pool is surrounded by a high wall and has boys' and girls' changing rooms. The money for these things was provided by the Parent Teacher Association. In the summer each class tries to use the pool every day if the weather allows. It is a facility which provides great enjoyment whilst also giving children an opportunity to learn to swim. Indeed by the time they leave Instow School most of the children are able to swim.
